You are my son. Therefore, out of my natural affection and admiration for you, and for the sake of your future well-being, and having a perfect desire to give you some property, I hereby transfer to you, with all rights and with all rights, the vacant land as per Schedule III below, from the date of inheritance to the present day, the vacant land as per Schedule III, having been in my possession, and having removed all legal impediments, I hereby transfer to you, with all rights and with all rights, the vacant land as per Schedule III below, valued at Rs. 1,56,000/- (literally one lakh eighty six thousand rupees), with all rights and with all rights, and hereby transfer it to you with all rights and with all rights.
Therefore, from now on, you shall use the said settlement deed property as per your wish, get this property registered in your name in the records of the Gram Panchayat, pay the taxes of the Gram Panchayat yourself, and enjoy the happiness of your children, grandchildren, great-grandchildren and descendants in perpetuity with all the rights of loan, donation, oppression, exchange, sale and right of succession. This property does not belong to the Government or its agencies. No mortgages, agreements etc. have been made to this property by banks. This property is an undisputed and undisputed property in which no one else has any rights except me. I hereby give my full consent to this settlement deed, stating that I, my remaining heirs, you, your heirs, your subjects, and I will never have any disputes, encumbrances, objections or disputes over the property as per the schedule. This property does not belong to the Government or the Agency. This property is not an assignment under Ordinance 2/1977. There are no missionaries or anything like that on this property and if the prosecution proves that there are any, I will be fully liable for the payment of stamp duty under sections 27 and 64 of the Indian Stamp Act. Position attached hereto. V. Valaveni

Declaration
We have examined the details of the EC regarding the same. New section
under U/S 22-B(Central Act 16 of 1908) vide Andhra Pradesh Ordinance No. 7 of 2016 dated 03-12-2016.
I hereby declare that the property transferred by this settlement deed i.e. inherited by me is not owned by anyone other than me and that I have not sold, traded or otherwise disposed of the property to anyone else. I am fully responsible for any discrepancies in the above. I hereby declare that if the property mentioned in this deed is found to have been previously disposed of or if the provisions of section 22B of the Registration Act, 1908 are violated, I shall be liable to be punished under section 82 of the Indian Registration Act, 1908. v. sections.content: The property covered under Gift Settlement Deed No. 42 of 2026, dated 06/Jan/2026, executed by Vaddadhi Neelaveni, in favour of her Son Vaddadhi Santosh, towards the property admeasuring an extent of 62.33 Sq. Yds, Located Nearby House No. 1-2-156, comprised in survey number 232-3P, situated in Burja Village & Gram Panchayati, Burja Mandal, within the District of Srikakulam, registered at sub-registrar office Palakonda, is bounded as follows: North by: C.C. Road South by: RCC House of Sri Ramavalasa Ramesh East by: House of Vandana Venkata Rao West by: Petals House of Gollapalli Rama Rao
It is noted from the given documents and EC that the schedule property is not part of any active Mortgage or Lease Deed.

Note: It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible.
